page.title: 18The Museum _ Fordingbridge.
page.content: During the 150 years they have been builders in the town, generations of Sherings have unearthed and preserved countless objects of historical interest and in 1975 a{Fordingbridge {museum}was opened. The aim of this museum is to maintain a permanent collection of relics and bygones from the Fordingbridge area, together with records of local business, sport and the social life of the inhabitants. It is a non-profit-making concern and run for the benefit of the community, so there is no admission charge, but visitors may make a donation as they leave. It is estimated that there are anything from 5000 to 10000 individual items in the collection _ tools, photographs, old documents, household utensils etc. and many of these have now been catalogued.
